turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Deal or No Deal (Australian game show).
turn.1: What is the show Deal or No Deal about?
turn.2: The end of game Mega-Guess has adopted a small gag where either the podium player, main contestant, or O'Keefe himself must beg the banker to give the player a Mega-Guess.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: The Mega-Guess feature has been altered several times during its history.
turn.5: What caused it to be altered?
turn.6: When first introduced, during the "$12 Million Month" special, it had a fixed amount win of $10,000.
turn.7: Did it remain the same after the alterations?
turn.8: When it returned in the 2005 season, the amount won was reduced to $5,000.
turn.9: Did they make any other changes?
turn.10: In the 2006 season, it was altered to its current format, where either $2,000 (Blue), $5,000 (Maroon), or $10,000 (Green) could be won.
turn.12: The $5,000 Mega-Guess has the most common appearance, sometimes showing up several times during a game, followed by the $10,000 Mega-Guess which would appear once early during the game, and sometimes at the end.
